brief_description: ELISPOT was used to enumerate the number of IFN gamma-secreting CD4+ peripheral blood mononuclear cells isolated from healthy naive donors following stimulation with APCs treated with peptide pools or whole virus
brief_title: CD4+ T Cells Generated from Encounter with Seasonal Influenza Viruses and Vaccines Can Recognize Epitopes Derived from Pandemic H1N1 Virus
condition_studied: healthy naive donor PBMCs stimulated with APCs treated with whole influenza virus or peptide pools
description: ELISPOT was used to enumerate the number of IFN gamma-secreting CD4+ peripheral blood mononuclear cells isolated from healthy naive donors following stimulation with APCs treated with peptide pools or whole virus
endpoints: Enumerate the number of IFN gamma-secreting CD4+ peripheral blood mononuclear cells
hypothesis: Seasonal Influenza Viruses and Vaccines May Recognize Epitopes Derived from Pandemic H1N1 Virus
objectives: Seasonal Influenza Viruses and Vaccines May Recognize Epitopes Derived from Pandemic H1N1 Virus
official_title: CD4+ T Cells Generated from Encounter with Seasonal Influenza Viruses and Vaccines Can Recognize Epitopes Derived from Pandemic H1N1 Virus

arm.description: Healthy adults with ages 18-50 with informed consent and biosafety committee approval
arm.name: ELISPOT_Cohort

pubmed.title: Cutting edge: CD4 T cells generated from encounter with seasonal influenza viruses and vaccines have broad protein specificity and can directly recognize naturally generated epitopes derived from the live pandemic H1N1 virus.

program.program_name: NIAID Centers of Excellence for Influenza Research and Surveillance (CEIRS)
program.contract_name: New York Influenza Center of Excellence
